website_summaries.verdict: Made from almonds and coconuts for a creamy dairy-free addition to coffee.
pros: Formulated to better mimic dairy creamers with a thicker texture, which may help those who are new to non-dairy creamers
Nutpods come in many flavors, and users love that they can get a variety pack to taste all of them
They are gluten-free and vegan, making them perfect to fit with many dietary needs
cons: Prone to separation, so it needs to be mixed in the coffee or frothed before adding

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.text: I was dismayed when my doctor insisted that I go sugar and dairy-free as I love coffee but cannot drink it without creamer. I searched and searched for a dairy-free alternative but only found the soy, almond and coconut milk options. YUCK! By chance I came across Nutpods and decided to give it a try. I love this product! It is the creamy texture I want and the flavor I crave. Definite homerun and I vow to never run out.
customer_reviews.author: A. Anson

customer_reviews.title: Froth it first for no separation
customer_reviews.text: Finally a great alternative for cream in my coffee! This is actually the second brand I found that is very good, but this one has flavors and no sugar! My only complaint with this and the other is the separation that can occur, but I fixed that! Simply froth it when it's cold or room temp and not only does it fix the separation issue with this type of creamer, but it creates a wonderful cappuccino style coffee too :)
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but quality product
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this product. I recently gave up dairy and my one "worry" was finding a replacement for my half and half for coffee. This provides a very similar texture and creaminess as half and half, though it isn't as thick (to be expected). I appreciate that there's no added sweetness or flavors. The flavored ones are very faint, nothing overpowering or too intense. My one wish is that this came in a larger container/quantity for less. It's hard to swallow spending $14 on coffee creamer for 40 ounces...not sure it's a long term sustainable option for me at these prices. The price is the reason I took off a star.
customer_reviews.author: KM83

customer_reviews.title: Wow ... Amazing Flavor
customer_reviews.text: Nutpod Dairy Free Creamer is amazing. I really enjoyed the flavor. I used the hazelnut first. I bought the three flavor pack. Best creamer for coffee/tea. It is nice to have a non fat no sugar creamer that holds up to coffee as far as thick and not watery. I usually like a sugar substitute but Nutpods has flavor enough without having to add that sweetness. I will be definitely buying and using Nutpods. It is a welcomed switch in our home. Update: Because single serving size not available I have a small silicone container I put in my purse. See photo below.... used a teaspoon in comparison
customer_reviews.author: Busy Nana

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: For the steep cost of this product, I had high expectations for a rich and creamy addition to my coffee. The flavors taste fine- nothing special. However, the consistency is really thin and not at all creamy. If you’re used to using half and half in your coffee, you will be really disappointed, as I was. I would recommend saving your money and just putting regular soy milk or almond milk into your coffee. It will achieve the same effect at a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: CCL

customer_reviews.title: Great non-dairy creamer alternative - reasonable price too!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. Last year, I was told I had a slight gluten and dairy sensitivity and have made a concerted effort to eliminate as much dairy from my diet as possible. The biggest problem area was finding a non-dairy coffee creamer I actually liked. This is a really nice alternative! No added sugar and just enough flavor, creamy texture to lighten a pretty hefty cup of coffee; I confess, I was raised to brew coffee that's more like battery acid than regular coffee! And the price is more than reasonable for what most non-dairy plant based products cost. Definitely worth a shot if you find yourself in a similar predicament.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah A. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great in Coffee
customer_reviews.text: These are really good replacements for what I usually use in my coffee; Lower in Calories, not sweet, and the consistency of regular creamer's. Also great because they're vegan non dairy. I am not a vegan but I cut out milk products. They do have the great taste of hazelnut and vanilla. And they have plain for cooking soup or adding to savory dishes like Curry because they all have a hint of coconut.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Clumped, disgusting
customer_reviews.text: really love how there are 4 different flavors (original, caramel, french vanilla, hazelnut) and they all taste so good and it mixes in my coffee so well, i love that it isn't even that many calories and still taste so amazing, deff buying another pack soon, i just wish their was more ounces per bottle, since it is on the kinda expensive side! UPDATE: So disgusting the nut milk clumped and the supposed expiration date is not until next year, absolutely disgusting, did not even last, a complete waste of money, don’t purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: Huma_22

customer_reviews.title: Great for Whole30 and healthier living thereafter
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing - I started buying it because of Whole30, but I continued using it after because I preferred it to my usual whole milker or half & half in my coffee. Both the taste and the amount needed took a couple days, but after that, awesomeness. One tip: Use a spoon or measuring spoon because it comes out fast and it is easy to get too much in your coffee. I've found that 2.5 tablespoons is perfect for a large cup (~10 ounces) of coffee. All the flavors are good, but French Vanilla is my fave. The variety pack is nice just to see what you like.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for a dairy free creamer, not a replacement for half and half.
customer_reviews.text: This is ok. It's probably the best dairy free creamer I've tried, especially considering there's no sugar in it. Most dairy free creamers have some sort of sugar added to them to try to make them work/taste better. You have to use much more of it than half and half. Also it is definitely not as creamy as half and half, but it does come closer to it than other dairy free creamers I've tried. Since you have to use so much in a cup to make it at all creamy, I probably won't buy this much just due to cost. It's not a bad option for every now and then though.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Just drink it black instead.
customer_reviews.text: If you dont like coconut cream, dont buy this. It tastes like despair. If you use a serving size, it's enough to ruin your coffee. It's just terrible. You're better off getting coconut cream from the can. It's like you added a splash of almond breeze to your coffee. I really dont like it.
customer_reviews.author: Scooty

customer_reviews.title: An actual, awesome non-dairy creamer replacement!
customer_reviews.text: I've been on Keto for a few years now, and I'm starting to move to non-dairy. The one thing I couldn't give up was my morning creamer. Half-and-half is just too delicious. I searched Amazon to find something that would be edible, and I decided to try this one. It's good. Really good. At 0g carbs, only 10 calories per Tbsp, and three flavors, I've officially switched from half-and-half, and I can use as much as I want without feeling guilty. Good job guys, this creamer is great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Evin

customer_reviews.title: as the consistency is much better when it is cold
customer_reviews.text: The plain and French Vanilla creamer actually stay smooth in tea and coffee and does not separate into tiny granules as many others do. Unfortunately I can't say the same for the Hazelnut flavor. Be sure to put it in the refrigerator before using, as the consistency is much better when it is cold. These little containers do not need to be refrigerated until opened, which is a huge advantage - you can buy quite a few and put them in the cupboard for use later. No sugar, no carragenen, no other bad stuff.
customer_reviews.author: HKT

customer_reviews.title: I just like my coffee stronger and have come to the conclusion ...
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my final try of liquid creamer... I have decided that I am just not a fan of liquid creamer. I will say, for a nut based creamer, this one was the most smooth, creamy and frothy. I just like my coffee stronger and have come to the conclusion that powdered creamer is more my thing. The flavors were not that strong either, which for me was good, as I also dislike flavored creamers... But I am always willing to try a new vegan option!! If you like liquid creamers, you will most likely love this one!
customer_reviews.author: Kellie F.

customer_reviews.title: Flavor is good. Size does matter
customer_reviews.text: I like Nutpods. I read several of the reviews before receiving my order and was concerned that I wasted my money. However, I find the flavor very good. There is little to no “lightening” but the appearance is not as important to me as the flavor. I have added a teaspoon of 4% milk to lighten my coffee on occasion. My biggest complaint is the size. I expected a larger amount compared to the price. I may order the product again, but cost does matter.
customer_reviews.author: DBaker

customer_reviews.title: I usually just use unsweetened vanilla almond milk and I didn't think this was much better. I tried using the recommended serving size of ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was ok, but for the price I won't be buying again. I usually just use unsweetened vanilla almond milk and I didn't think this was much better. I tried using the recommended serving size of 1 tbsp. but I needed a lot more than that. I probably used 4 tbsp to get the creaminess and flavor that I like. If you use that much it is 40 calories and only about 5 servings per container. I use probably a 1/2 cup of regular almond milk and I think it tastes about the same, but only 15 calories and a 1/2 gallon lasts me a lot longer!
customer_reviews.author: Jaimee J.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but tasty
customer_reviews.text: Not a great value - (3) pack of very small 11.2 oz. cartons for $14+tax - that's approximately $.68/per serving. It's tasty but not high quality enough to replace an MCT oil supplement or to be a buttered coffee alternative. I use both in my coffee currently. It does not have the additives carrageenan or polysorbate-80, which is great if you're concerned about your gut health. I also bought the caramel (4) pack which tastes good as well and is a better value, but overall I will look for it at a better price before buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT DAIRY FREE CREAMER!
customer_reviews.text: I wish it were lower in fat but here I have got to draw a line on creamer for my coffee. I have given up on many things in my eating habits but coffee has got to be enjoyable. With all the creamers I have tried and not using sugar, I have switched to xylitol, I find Nut Pods the closest I am likely to get to my perfect cup of coffee. It has an amazing texture and has a pleasing flavor without overpowering the coffee flavor. If making it low fat changes any of this, even a little bit then it will, more than likely, not be nearly as good.
customer_reviews.author: A. Geer

customer_reviews.title: I'll need to get used to the flavor
customer_reviews.text: In my coffee the flavor is definitely different but I've been using the same coffee mate powder for years and your palate gets used to it. Even cows milk tastes strange to me now. I drank some of this right out of the container and it actually tasted good. I like the nutty coconut flavor, but in coffee it will be an acquired taste. I like zero carbs. That's my main motivation for using this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E.

customer_reviews.title: Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for an unsweetened replacement for half and half for coffee. This is too expensive to be an option; while the label indicates that there are 22 servings in each container, what works in my real world is that I get 2 servings. I like coffee very light and a bit cooled down, so if takes half of a container to do that. The original unsweetened is closest to half and half, but not half as enjoyable. While I never cared for flavored coffee, I decided to try these because they are unsweetened. I still don't like flavored coffee, although if you do you may like these. The flavoring ingredient was too noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: No flavor not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: These are honesty not worth the money. Firstly the containers are time like the size of a coconut water in the cardboard. So then I thought well maybe they are tiny because they have a lot of flavor NOPE! I put almost half of the caramel flavor in my coffee I got a little nutty flavor and a bit of caramel in aftertaste. This is not a good switch from regular creamer. Feel jaded I spent $16 on nothing. You are better off using your heavy cream and monk fruit or any of the sugar free syrup flavors wayyyy cheaper and wayyyyy better.
customer_reviews.author: Varonica Grills

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I'd hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my Nutpods! I enjoyed all three flavored. Normally I would prefer black coffee over any nut milks in my coffee because they're just too thin. But the Nutpods are perfectly creamy. I even used the original flavor in my mashed potatoes as another reviewer suggested and it totally helped make them creamier (I'm doing the Whole30 so the only other ingredient I used was ghee). They also came perfectly fine through the mail. (Another reviewer said hers were frozen on arrival so I was a bit worried about that)
customer_reviews.author: CA

customer_reviews.title: Substitute for Cream in Coffee
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great. I have completely weaned myself off heavy cream, which is what I used to put in my coffee. Now I use this product. It is not quite as creamy but it has many benefits: it is non-dairy, it is low-calorie, it is delicious. I would recommend the subscribe-and-save option for buying and I am switching to buying one 4-pack of each of the three flavors instead of 3 of the variety packs. The cost is about the same and you get 4 containers of each flavor instead of three. It does not need to be refrigerated until you open it, which is also a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: MikeDBMan

customer_reviews.title: YUCK & Can’t be returned
customer_reviews.text: I normally like the taste of coconut/almond milk products. I use them daily and I’m familiar with many brands. This was SO gross. How are there are so many good reviews??? I purchased this because of those reviews. Also, this can’t be returned (doesn’t say that on the purchase page). I’d rather throw this away and take the loss, than use it again. ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R.

customer_reviews.title: Best dairy free creamer out there
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought the French vanilla from a local store but they don’t offer a variety pack so I decided to purchase the this pack from amazon. I was really excited about the Carmel and hazelnut. It’s really good creamer but the flavor is really mild (reason for 4 stars). I used it in my cold brew and it mixes well. Small packaging is nice so I can fit it in the shared mini fridge at work. Nutpods also replaced my package after it was frozen in the mail (Midwest problems). I’ll definitely buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Sobolik

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: My sister and cousin raved about these. We're dairy-free, so after decades of black coffee I gave it a try. These mix in like cream, without oil floating on the top like other creamers. I found the flavored options to have an aftertaste that I didn't like. They are very nice for baking. I would recommend that you try them if you haven't. I am not changing my coffee habits with them, but I will keep a few regular flavor containers in my pantry in case I'm baking something that will be better with a creamier non-dairy substitution.
customer_reviews.author: Boston Mom

customer_reviews.title: Nut Pods
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried the Pumpkin Spice yet, as I also ordered the mixed flavor of Nut Pods. I have started with the French Vanilla and am so happy with these pods. They suit all my desires for a creamer that was unsweetened and fat free. It makes my coffee taste like a dessert (I do add a drop of stevia) and it tastes positively decadent. I also used the Original in a soup I made last night. So wonderful to be able to use this in recipes. I am looking forward to using the Pumpkin Spice, but since they are shelf stable until opened, I will finish what I opened first.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: KETO BUYERS - Not for use in regular coffee IMHO
customer_reviews.text: Unless you just want a weird nutty flavored coffee, then this is not an option for a Keto creamer. I had to try it out but between the huge expense and too much nuttiness, not a fan at all. Might be useful for other coffee drinks (as mentioned in some comments), but didn't work as a Keto creamer option for me. Oh well!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Schramm

customer_reviews.title: Too bad, a big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this small family business, unfortunately they are underwhelming. I go from bean to cup, from roasting my own beans to weighing everything just so. This creamers turns you great cup of coffee watery. It is a thin creamer, so you need a lot to get taste out of the product. I would say I used 1 pod for 3 cups of coffee, so not only are they more expensive than other creamers, you double or triple that cost and ruin your coffe with the high volume of creamer need to clamor your cup.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D. Sainz

customer_reviews.title: Love these!!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently did a Whole30 diet but prior to that I was a black coffee drinker with one teaspoon of sugar. I needed something in my coffee (because sugar is not allowed) so I discovered these. The hazelnut is my favorite! Its good in hot or iced coffee or tea. I don't find it to have a strong coconut flavor, but my sister (who hates coconut) said it taste like coconut. Even after my whole30 diet I still order these to put in my morning coffee. One of the cartons was damaged in the shipping process, but I was quickly refunded and was able to order another box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Healthy alternative to milk in my coffee
customer_reviews.text: I chose these products because I am doing Whole30 and I have always used cream in my coffee. These are the healthy alternative and they are compliant with W30. I enjoy the hazelnut flavor most of all. This is mild and not overpowering. I generally blend this with a little original. Honestly, I don’t like the vanilla. It does not have a good flavor. I still prefer milk in my coffe most if all, but I am thankful for this alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget S

customer_reviews.title: So glad I made the switch
customer_reviews.text: I used to only drink hazelnut coffee mate creamer. I thought it was going to be a hard switch, and although it’s not exactly the same, it is certainly better. I feel better all around after drinking my coffee and I’ve lost weight because of it. It makes my coffee light and the taste is so smooth. I tell everyone to make the switch! Dairy free/sugar free is the way to go and this makes it easy.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought the sample pack of 4 flavors. The first one I opened was lumpy, and did not melt when in hot coffee. I figured it was just that flavor. However, all four of them were lumpy. How can that be with a non-dairy product. It was like bad cream. I dumped them all! They had no flavor either. When I did pour it into my coffee, along with all the lumps, I had to pour about 1/4 of a container for the coffee to get lighter. Not a product I would purchase again, it's just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: philip

customer_reviews.title: The closest to dairy that I've found
customer_reviews.text: I've tried what seems like every non-dairy creamer with clean ingredients that I can find. This one has the closest richness to dairy that I've found. It's unsweetened, which is perfect. There's basically no flavor, so like the other reviewers mentioned, they all taste the same, but that's not really a problem for me since I'm mostly wanting the creamy texture with no weird aftertaste. This fits the bill! Smooth and rich and doesn't taste like coconut or almonds. However, the price is crazy (currently 13.95). Unfortunately I think that's going to have to come way down before we'll be repurchasing. Otherwise this stuff is exactly what I've been searching for.
customer_reviews.author: WannabeArtist

customer_reviews.title: Very small containers for the price & does not froth/foam well
customer_reviews.text: The flavors don't come through all that well, but the unflavored was fine, they all pretty much tasted like that. The hazelnut was the only one that frothed/foamed. I've been on the hunt for a dairy alternative that doesn't have carragenen (sp?) or palm additives. "Milked" Hazelnut & their Almond milk are awesome for frothing, but I can't find them in stores anymore. The hunt continues. The flavor on this is okay, just very small size for the amount you're paying
customer_reviews.author: Kay Aay

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST- product and customer service!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I have been looking for. Creamy, delicious & healthy! My husband and I will no longer use any other creamer and we run out quicker than we expect! We are enrolled in the monthly subscription option and got notification this month that our product was out of stock and they were experiencing a slight delay. I reached out to Amy & Customer Service and was surprised when I not only got a response from her personally but, she sent a FREE 12 PACK OF CREAMERS to get us by until our was back in stock. This product is amazing and so are the people behind it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really delicious!
customer_reviews.text: I just love these creamers it’s so nice not to have to try and go into the store and get creamer in the refrigerated section this little box does not need to be refrigerated and I was looking at the package today it doesn’t look like it needs to be refrigerated even after you open it (but I still do ) the flavors are great I love the hazelnut, even the plain is really good though it’s really nice to just get away from dairy with my coffee
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are the best! In my second round of whole 30 and ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the best! In my second round of whole 30 and so glad I found an approved creamer I actually like. Creamy with a hint of flavor so good. My very favorite is hazelnut, then regular and I add cinnamon then vanilla. I'm not sure why vanilla is my least favorite. Next purchase I will buy all hazelnut.
customer_reviews.author: tim bradley

customer_reviews.title: it's not sweet, don't be surprised when it's not) then its ...
customer_reviews.text: I think as long as your expectations are in check (read: it's not sweet, don't be surprised when it's not) then its fine. It does add a small amount of flavor and mild creaminess that I have grown to enjoy in my 100% Arabica Keurig K-Cups. I'll keep buying them, so far only tried the Hazelnut and it smells nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Ro

customer_reviews.title: Great dairy free option!
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to cut out as much dairy as possible and since my morning coffee is a must, I decided to try this. It took some getting used to at first, but now I don't notice a difference in taste between my old creamer (filled with sugar and artificial junk) and this one. The only negative, if it really is one, is that the creamer doesn't really stir in well. It starts off looking blended and smooth, but after sitting for a bit it separates a bit (if that makes sense). Still a great option for dairy free!
customer_reviews.author: TLC

customer_reviews.title: Whole 30 lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: I recently discovered Nutpods while looking for a dairy & sugar-free alternative for my morning coffee. I am doing the Whole 30, and my options were limited to coconut milk and almond milk. Nutpods is seriously a lifesaver! It's thick and creamy, just like my favorite coffee cream. The Hazelnut and french vanilla are a great twist with a little extra flavor, but they don't taste artificial. And the best part is that it froths beautifully in my Nespresso aeroccino, so I can have my morning cappuccino or latte! I haven't been able to get any brand of unsweetened almond milk to do that!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: variety pack
customer_reviews.text: So far I've tried only the hazelnut and it's delicious. I'm used to heavy whipping cream in my coffee, so this is an adjustment if that's what you're used to. I'm trying to eliminate dairy in my diet eventually. This is helping. I also find that using this in my coffee for bullet proof recipes is helpful because when you blend it, it gets creamier. Also good for enhancing protein shakes made with almond milk, pea protein milk, or whatever you use. I've not tried the other 2 flavors yet, if my review should change, I'll update it.
customer_reviews.author: DMM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but pricey
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints about this product, other than the price! I loved seeing this brand at Costco and scooped up several every trip. Now it’s not offered anymore which is really sad! So I get my nutpods fix here but my pockets are hurting! About the product though - yummy, creamy, and doesn’t make you feel like you’re being “healthy” with your coffee. No junk like normal creamers. Nice and clean. My husband counts macros so this is an excellent macro friendly option. I love nutpods!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie B.

customer_reviews.title: Buy It!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, life changing, delicious. So many words could be used to describe these! While I only made it halfway through Whole30 (got sick) I have continued to use these because they are seriously delicious. They were life saving during the Whole30 as I cannot stand black coffee, and we drink espresso/lattes everymorning. I did not try to froth the creamer, but would put about 1 table spoon per espresso and it was perfect. If you are going for Whole30 I would say dont hesitate and just spend the money, so worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Terry Passalacqua

customer_reviews.title: nutpods Variety 3-Pack, Unsweetened Dairy-Free Creamer
customer_reviews.text: Finally, finally, finally a healthy non-dairy coffee creamer that works as it should in coffee! Not only is it good in coffee but I've used it as a substitute for milk in recipes, for making chocolate milk and used it over cereal. My only regret is that it isn't organic but considering the alternatives, I happily set this up on my subscribe and save!
customer_reviews.author: CrazyAboutBooks

customer_reviews.title: The Non-Dairy Creamer I Have Been Searching For
customer_reviews.text: This is it! I have searched high and low for a non dairy creamer that does not have ANY gums of ANY kind. The sweetened versions of Nutpods you cannot really taste the sweetener, but I'm good with that because I don't like sweet coffee. The *only* complaint is that it separates in the coffee. This does not affect the taste or even consistency believe it or not. I use my Magic Bullet to blend it along with cacao powder and it's bomb diggity. I will be ordering again and have already been recommending to others. Definitely give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: Jmamelia

customer_reviews.title: Coffe in bed with Nutpods
customer_reviews.text: They are fantastic - just a hint of flavor and adds the perfect amount of creaminess.
customer_reviews.author: Honorata Lee

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed by this product. For the price you barely get anything. The containers are so small. I was willing to overlook the small size if it tasted amazing but it doesn’t. It’s thin and everything tasted faintly of coconut (and nothing else). Also when I added it to my coffee it just kind of separated and didn’t mix well like regular creamer.
customer_reviews.author: bookworm

customer_reviews.title: NOT NUTS FOR COCONUT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a lot of non-dairy creamers with not much success. I was intrigued by the nut pods because of the nut part and I was hoping that the coconut was subtle ,but, unfortunately, I found the coconut to be over powering. I like that their product is non-gmo and vegan, but it isn't organic and considering the price... That would be nice. For traveIing I gave it 5 ⭐ because it's small. 2 ⭐ for blending power. 1 ⭐ for the flavor because I don't love the flavor, and for the price it's no better than other less expensive coconut creamers. Glad I tried it but I won't be back!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Versatile creamer
customer_reviews.text: I use Nutpods in my coffee and tea in the mornings. I have also used the original flavor while baking in place of milk and cream. It has taken me a while to warm up to the flavors. My favorite "flavor" is caramel because it's just the right hint of flavor without being too overpowering or too sweet. I like the consistency of Nutpods creamer. The price point is high, but I think the product is high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey K

customer_reviews.title: Regardless of flavor.  Tastes like coconut
customer_reviews.text: While I knew these were made with coconut milk, because they are flavored I really expected them to not taste like coconut as much as they did. If it says it’s hazelnut. I didn’t expect it to taste like coconut. That’s all I taste.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yummy dairy free creamer
customer_reviews.text: My biggest complaint about dairy free creamers are their creaminess. These creamers are delish, but not as creamy as half and half. I have yet to find a dairy free as creamy as that. That being said, Nutpods are very good tasting and add flavor without all the sugar. Since you don't need to refrigerate until you open it, it's great to bring along while traveling. I would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: oceanmmi

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly delicious!!
customer_reviews.text: I am doing Whole30. I was so distraught over not being able to have my coffee in the morning (just can’t drink it black). Dairy seems to bother my gut so even when I stop the program I will not go back to dairy. Nutpods is such a great alternative. I haven't tried all the flavors yet, so far love the vanilla.
customer_reviews.author: Carol N

customer_reviews.title: Shake carton and no curdling; love this product
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews about curdling which did happen with mine at first, however, I realized that if I shook it in the cartoon first, there is no curdling at all; just natural cream colored coffee and it remains so. It is great for traveling. The flavors aren't precisely like the chemical laced ones, but they are good none-the-less. You have to keep in mind that you are not comparing apples to apples so if you see it as a totally new product instead of comparing to those, maybe add a little sweetner if prefer (I don't), it is a great alternative to dairy, chemically laced products. Thank you so much Nutpod for giving us a healthier option.
customer_reviews.author: seeker

customer_reviews.title: Good job nutpod creator
customer_reviews.text: I have always had family and friends say, "Have a little tea with your cream or a little coffee with your cream." I was always the cream girl so trying to be more of a conscious consumer for products that don't involve any kind of cruelty, I have been on a quest for that "cream". I still miss cream but not the thought of what dairy cows and babies go through for me to have it. This nutpods Creamer has made my transition much easier, and I no longer have to experiment at home making some gross alternatives in the Vitamix. Good job nutpod creator!
customer_reviews.author: cathy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product and have purchased it many times. It is a great alternative to coffee creamer and I love that it is dairy free. I'm sure I will continue to purchase it for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thin & Bland
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a low/no sugar alternative to creamer but was left really dissapointed by these- I don't notice any flavor at all (from French Vanilla or Hazelnut) and it is very thin so I felt like I have to use way too much with each cup. Although half and half isn't an ideal choice for me I'd rather use a small splash of it than several tbsp of this. Won't be ordering again.
customer_reviews.author: AshLovesAnt

customer_reviews.title: It’s good just add extra.
customer_reviews.text: I am glad I sampled the product I have no complaints whatsoever the flavor is just fine depending on what flavor you like. I just felt personally I wish the flavor was stronger whatever your taste is for the flavor whether it’s French vanilla or hazelnut or whatever you want. I felt I had to add a lot more of the creamer to get the taste I’m accustomed to. Otherwise it’s a very nice creamer.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M. Szuda

customer_reviews.title: Whole30 Holy Grail!
customer_reviews.text: I do Whole30 frequently, so I am always on the hunt for products to add flavor and spice up my diet while remaining compliant, and these NutPods have been a staple since I found them! I use them as coffee creamer, and they taste just as good (if not better than) any dairy-based creamer. I've also used them as a cream substitute in several Whole30 recipes such as quiche, sour cream, whipped cream, and banana bites. I'm sure there are many more uses I will be discovering as well! I love these things - I always keep all 3 of these flavors on deck!
customer_reviews.author: Kali

customer_reviews.title: I’m learning to love it.
customer_reviews.text: Trying to be healthier. It’s not been fun. These arnt horrible but I’m a recovering sugar and carb addict. My other half loves them so I’m stuck with them now. I hope I adapt soon. Flavors arnt bad just not as exciting as the unhealthy options I’m use too. It’s definitely better then nothing. The caramel one goes great with a little monk fruit sweetener and community golden caramel coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Captain B.

customer_reviews.title: Delicious non-diary creamer variety pack
customer_reviews.text: I like the variety of this three pack. It includes the original flavor, french vanilla, and hazelnut. I use these for a convenient, non-diary option in my coffee. I enjoy all three flavors with french vanilla being my favorite. The texture of the creamer is smooth. This is my go to creamer. So glad to have found Nutpods!
customer_reviews.author: Free to be Me

customer_reviews.title: Good product, brewing method matters!
customer_reviews.text: Amended review: I really do not want to give such a bad review, but I am tired of 'creamers' which are 'just like the real thing'. I purchased the variety pack which included original, hazelnut, and french vanilla. They do feel more like dairy and that is cool. There is a bit more of a coconut flavor that I hoped for, but I have since realized that it depends on the brewing method of the coffee. In an automatic drip, Hazelnut tastes like coconut; french vanilla tastes like coconut; and the original tastes like plastic smells. However, in a French Press, the french vanilla is wonderful with enough added and enough sweetener.
customer_reviews.author: rdp

customer_reviews.title: A nice alternative to other unsweetened NDCs
customer_reviews.text: These are great for Whole30 coffees. The Hazelnut flavor is more of a hint, could be stronger but not bad. The French Vanilla is by far the best unsweetened dairy free creamer I have had. The Original flavor is okay but I would save it for cooking instead of using in coffee. -Be careful when opening the cap, one of mine ripped off the entire top when opening.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This may be just what you're looking for
customer_reviews.text: For me it would be 5 stars, but I don't use creamer in my coffee. My wife uses creamer and sweetener in her coffee. She claims to want to be dairy free, soy free and sweetener free, so I was trying to help her out. She hasn't touched it. She said that she'd rather just use her almond milk (which is sweetened.) I think that you get the picture here. This is an excellent product for those who want it. I drink my coffee black. I tried these nutpods and liked them a lot. I would still rather have my coffee black. I often drink coffee bulletproof with a ghee and MCT oil.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory P. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Keto Creamer
customer_reviews.text: I love nut pods there are a great addition to my coffee when needing a little something. I’ve done keto for quite awhile and was looking for a little something to add to my coffee and stumbled upon this. The creamers are not too sweet and add just enough flavor to my coffee. I like to get the variety pack because I get bored easily. I have not found a flavor I didn’t like, even the original is good.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best healthy non-dairy creamer I've tried so far, but nowhere near real cream.
customer_reviews.text: OK, but it's not cream. I would give it 4-5 stars for being the best replacement for real cream that I have tried so far, and for being free from nasty additives. But, as for flavor and texture, to me it's a 3 - or just OK - compared to the real thing. But, I absolutely hated the other non-dairy creamers I have tried, except for the unhealthy ones that are loaded with artificial flavors, casein (milk protein), and other junk. So, take my rating in that context. I don't like my coffee sweet when I use real cream, but I find that this benefits from a little bit of stevia.
customer_reviews.author: Tsu Dho Nihm

customer_reviews.title: A great substitute
customer_reviews.text: Let’s be honest, there is no substitute for half and half or heavy cream in your coffee. However, if you’re on Whole 30 like me or lactose intolerant, this is definitely the best and creamiest substitute I’ve found. I prefer the original since I don’t like sweet coffee, but the French vanilla will add a bit of sweetness if you like that. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lamm Famm

customer_reviews.title: Nutpods
customer_reviews.text: As a DIY'er I thought these were a silly idea, "just make your own!", but I have to admit, I liked the ease of use. Of course, they are not going to trick you into thinking that you are actually having a dairy product, but they are a good substitute. I like the ingredients list and the lack of the ingredient, sugar! I'm not sure that I would buy them again due to the cost. Overall, my opinion is that Nutpods are a good product.
customer_reviews.author: HopeF.

customer_reviews.title: Zero flavor
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these due to great reviews and recommendations and they absolutely have ZERO flavor even the caramel. It’s NOT returnable which it doesn’t say that anyone but says 100% satisfaction so I had to contact Amazon for the refund because I’m not satisfied
customer_reviews.author: StacyFreddy

customer_reviews.title: Great Flavor
customer_reviews.text: If you need to be dairy free but miss the taste of real cream, look no further. Nutpods are wonderfully full of flavor and give coffee or tea the body you are seeking from a creamer. I love the original variety back containing plain, vanilla and hazelnut. Love them so much I sent a set to as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: bansheemom

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected, but okay
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try these for purposes of trying Whole 30. For that, they work well, since they are non dairy, and do not seem to cause inflammation in the body. However, I was a bit disappointed in the flavor of them. Tasted a bit artificial to me, and while they did blend well, and were good for taking with me unopened when travelling, I think I actually prefer regular coconut or almond milk beverage for non dairy lightener for my coffee. They were worth trying, but I did not really like them enough to get them again.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Young

customer_reviews.title: Creamy & Flavorful
customer_reviews.text: I love these; however, I do have to add a sugar substitute. If you like your coffee sweet, this will not be enough. I used to use sugar free vanilla creamer and it was enough. I changed to these because they are much healthier. They are great (the hazelnut does leave an after taste that I am not a fan of); however, must add a sweetner. Overall, I am super happy and have continued to buy. They have a great creamy texture.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Love to have the WHole30 option for my coffee
customer_reviews.text: Love to have the Whole30 option for my coffee. Even off Whole30, Nutpods are a great non-dairy and healthier cream option for coffee. I use even when not doing Whole 30. Provide the best foam for a frothy cup of coffee. Just use an inexpensive hand frother. A non dairy coffee shop coffee at home.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Creamy, sugar-free, dairy free creamer. Strong flavors
customer_reviews.text: Pros: half & half like creamy consistency great for coffee. Sugar free & dairy free. Cons: flavored variety is very strong and artificial tasting Go for the original flavor if looking for a creamy half & half alternative non-dairy, sugar free creamer
customer_reviews.author: Jane M.

customer_reviews.title: Whips up well in Aeroccino
customer_reviews.text: I had the same complaints about the separation issues some of the others did, and when I contacted the company about it they said it was normal due to the acidity of coffee and offered to send me a pack of my favorite flavor to give it another chance, recommending that I use a little more in my coffee. They were fast and responsive. I’ve discovered that it whips up nicely in my Aeroccino and really makes a nice espresso (I use hazelnut nutpods and a dash of maple syrup). I’ve pretty much quit going to Starbucks now and I’m glad I gave Nutpods a second chance!
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Great option for dairy free.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great option for folks who avoid dairy. While definitely not half and half, it provides a creaminess for coffee that I would, otherwise, not be able to drink during my Whole 30 focus for the month of January. While they are a little pricey compared to half and half and milk, I like having this option. I have tried the plain flavor which is good for flavored coffee and the hazelnut. It took a little getting used to the flavor but after 2 or 3 sips I was loving it. Nutpods, please bring your products to the Whole Foods in Houston!
customer_reviews.author: Z Traveler

customer_reviews.title: These creamers are AMAZING. They were gone within days
customer_reviews.text: These creamers are AMAZING. They were gone within days. I used the original flavor in a cream sauce for a pasta dish that came out SO good that we made it twice in one week. The french vanilla and hazelnut went in my coffee. I wish these came in bigger sizes (maybe they do, i actually haven't looked yet).. Note that the flavored creamers are not sweet which was perfect for me as i don't like sweet coffee. but if you do like sweet, you'll need to add sugar. highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: I have issues with dairy but loooooove 1/2 & 1/2 or heavy cream in my coffee. I don't care for sweetness and don't like flavored coffee creamers. I found these, tried them all and now subscribe to a case every few months. I like them all but my favorite is the original because it tastes like 1/2 & 1/2 without the issues of dairy for me. The other two are good, just taste more like sweetened coffee creamers to me so people who are looking to get off sweetened coffee creamers might like those more.
customer_reviews.author: AnotherMother

customer_reviews.title: Flavorless
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping these creamers would deliver what they promise. But, none of the 4 flavors have any actual flavor. They certainly are rich and creamy like half-and-half, but so bland. Both the hazelnut and the caramel smell great, but the flavor just does not translate. Disappointing, but with the low calories should’ve tipped me off that they wouldn’t be as sweet or flavorful as I hoped.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Heaton

customer_reviews.title: It tastes like regular creamer
customer_reviews.text: OMG! Just received my order yesterday. I was leery, especially after reading some of the reviews and trying some other creamers, but I'm here to tell you, this creamer is delicious. It tastes like regular creamer, but without the unwanted dairy, sugar, and chemicals. I only wish they sold them in bigger sizes. This is the first item I've gotten a dash button for. I just really can't believe it's this good. Color me impressed! Thanks to the developer.
customer_reviews.author: Genoa M. Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: I will not buy more, but i like the healthy concept
customer_reviews.text: it works ok but it takes a couple of table spoons to a cup. It really doesnt taste like i added creamer so i add njoy creamer. I like healthy things and for over a month i have become a vegitarian . But it seems like its watered down too much and it costs a lot. my last time to buy this is my first time. They need to go back to the lab and tweak this stuff. I would give it 3 stars but since its healthy i gave it 4. I will finish what i bought but unless it gets improved i will not order again. brian in baton rouge
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stuff
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is delicious!! I have been slowly trying to cut out dairy. I’m super picky with my coffee.. I’ve only tried the French vanilla and the original. Soo good! Love the taste.. I thought I would have to add tons of sweetener but that’s not the case. Only thing is I wish the brand had bigger packages one of the three bottles will be gone within 2-3 days.. I would buy a giant one if I could!
customer_reviews.author: Desiree

customer_reviews.title: Flavors: Very artificial tasting
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to get away from my soy vanilla creamer so I bought these to try. Unfortunately, all the flavored kinds are very harsh on the palate - almost chemical tasting. While I understand they are artificial flavors, I just couldn't bring myself to drink my coffee once added. I tried it by just adding it and then also by foaming it. I personally won't purchase again. It's too expensive to waste it and no one else in my household would drink it either.
customer_reviews.author: KMB

customer_reviews.title: Not quite what I was expecting!
customer_reviews.text: I was definitely hoping for more! The containers are pretty small, I have to use about a 5-8 sec pour. I love my creamer in my coffee but this just did not work for me. The price is way too high. If it where less expensive than I could use 1/4 of the bottle and not feel so bad. But it was $14.95 for 4 bottles and it will only give me about 12 cups of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: S. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Not comprable
customer_reviews.text: When I am using regular dairy sweet cream flavored creamer I like my coffee about 1/3 creamer and the rest coffee. I only tried the caramel and almost spit it out in the middle of teaching a class. I have to have creamer in my coffee for it to be drinkable. This stuff is about as flavorful as water for someone like me. Sad it did not meet my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting and expensive
customer_reviews.text: I'm a type 2 diabetic and as part of lowering my sugar intake, I'm always on the look out for low or no sugar options. I had already switched to almond milk in my coffee. The idea of a flavored creamer made with almond and coconut milk was exciting. However, I was thoroughly disappointed. The taste was wretched and the price for such small bottles was a further disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa S. Duck

customer_reviews.title: 10 Calories per serving AND tasty!
customer_reviews.text: I have only tried the french vanilla flavor. It is delicious and mixed like real creamer. I purchased bcuz of the 10 calories per serving. I had given up coffee while dieting and I missed it, but I couldn't afford over 100 calories on creamer (I like mine lighter, tried black and can't do it!). Price was great and I can't wait to try the other flavors. The fact they don't need refrigeration until after opening is great for when I travel too!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a Dairy Free creamer that tastes like creamer. Quite frankly, I don't know how they do it. Taste great! I had to go dairy free and sugar free for health reasons and I was so worried that my morning coffee was going to be unbearable but this Nutpods product saved my coffee ritual. I found it a little cheaper at Whole Foods but if you don't have a Whole Foods I recommend you get it here. All three flavors are good and I normally don't like flavor in my coffee. It's not overwhelming so it tastes good.
customer_reviews.author: CAT

customer_reviews.title: Nutpods are pricey but the next best thing to dairy creamer
customer_reviews.text: The mixed 4-pack was the most economical option from Amazon at the time. Usually it's offered in a 3-pack but at a higher per-item price. I prefer to buy these locally when I can, but on occasion the price online is attractive enough to order. This product doesn't seem to separate like some other non-dairy creamers, so it's (almost) worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: justfitz

customer_reviews.title: Nutpods: Making coffee great again!
customer_reviews.text: When I completed my first Whole30, I was always so disappointed in my coffee. I was used to using cream and sweetener and as I gave up dairy and sweeteners I tried so many unsweetened alternatives. Nothing ever made it creamy or yummy enough, so I just starting drinking black coffee. I was not disappointed since I knew it would be bitter. I learned to enjoy black coffee. When I saw a Whole30 approved creamer, I thought I'd try it, but had low expectations. I have tried the French Vanilla and I love it! It makes the coffee creamy and not sweet. It adds a subtle flavor and it isn't overpowering. I can't wait to try the others!
customer_reviews.author: L. Garrad

customer_reviews.title: Helped me transition to taking my coffee black
customer_reviews.text: The dairy free creamer often separated from the coffee, I didn’t particularly mind but my husband and family didn’t enjoy. The flavors are VERY mild which I somewhat expected, but if you are going from creamy sugary coffee to this don’t expect it to be similar. It helped me transition to black coffee, but in retrospect I probably would recommend just unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk to others....you can get more bang for your buck. I suppose this would be excellent for those that travel as they are small in size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaking when it arrived
customer_reviews.text: So I opened the package and it looked like picture attached :( the hazelnut is leaking. Was. It happy about that! My cat enjoyed licking the box . Haven't tried it since not sure if they are good??
customer_reviews.author: Ela Chicharron

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when I read the glowing reviews about this creamer. Coffee is religion and without half&half, its not the same. Nutpods are fine. Good taste, the flavors are nice. Similar to other coconut or almond based coffee creamers, you will still need a gallon to do the job of a tiny little splash of half&half. One of the containers lasted 3 to 4 days. But its just like the Silk or SoNice creamers. I would pay whatever amount necessary to have a non-dairy coffee creamer that works like half&half and is not made of chemicals or the excretions of grieving young cow mothers. This product, however, is not it.
customer_reviews.author: mweb

customer_reviews.title: Avoiding sugar and dairy? These are for you!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy to have found NutPods! The best. I am partial to the caramel flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn F.

customer_reviews.title: Product Damaged - Do not care for the taste
customer_reviews.text: Damaged, item not returnable but had no problem getting refund from Amazon and told to dispose the items. From what I did taste it was not good, mostly coconut flavor with and after taste. Silk original creamer is much better and has little sugar and carbs. I did purchase the Nutpods oat french vanilla and it has a good taste, almost like custard.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Good, easy......one but....
customer_reviews.text: I like these milk/cream alternatives. I can keep and not run out. I like the small sized containers too. My only CON is that it doesn't seem to mix as well as milk or even soy milk. At first I thought it was spoiled, but I think it's that it's not mixing well with our coffee (which we grind, as used).
customer_reviews.author: R BTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: Happy that this product is good for traveling and dairy free. It's creamy and doesn't leave little floaties like regular almond milk can in hot coffee. Also grateful this product doesn't have inulin or pea protein like a lot of others. 4 stars for flavor, because the vanilla and original taste the same. Not to say either are bad though. Haven't tried the hazelnut yet.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. and Mrs. B

customer_reviews.title: I mean, it's fine.
customer_reviews.text: I love heavy whipping cream in my coffee, but I'm now following a dairy-free lifestyle. Is Nutpods a substitution for heavy whipping cream? Absolutely not! But it's better than drinking black coffee. It's creamy enough and I've had no separation issues; it blends easily for me with just a spoon. You may also try a blender if you experience separation. One thing that helps me is adding a couple drops of stevia to my coffee when I'm using Nutpods. If you're expecting Nutpods to be the perfect substitution for cream, you will be disappointed. However, if you reset your expectations, you will come to like it.
customer_reviews.author: PersonalityTraits

customer_reviews.title: Learned to like it!
customer_reviews.text: Started using this during our 30 day paleo cleanse/diet. Didn't care for the taste initially, but now have learned to enjoy it after flushing all the sugar cravings from the body. The 30 day officially ended last night and after re-introducing bacon for breakfast this morning, I found my gut not agreeing with it. Perhaps it was a little bit much and too soon. Luckily I continue to use this creamer and can't see why I would actually stop.
customer_reviews.author: PacShore

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t see what all the fuss was about.
customer_reviews.text: Everyone raves about this stuff but I don’t see what all the fuss is about. I love milk and it’s flavor so it was a little hard for me to get used to the lack of milk flavor. If you don’t mind almond milk you may like it but it wasn’t for me. When I was doing whole30 I bought it. I didn’t love it. I just ended drinking black coffee cause I just couldn’t get used to the weird waxy flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Shu

product_meta.title: nutpods Variety 3 pack, Original, French Vanilla and Hazelnut Unsweetened Dairy-Free Liquid Coffee Creamer Made From Almonds and Coconuts
feature_bullets: Rich, smooth creamer made from almonds & coconuts
Free from Carrageenan, Dairy, Soy & Added Sugars. Certified Vegan, Kosher, Gluten-Free & Non-GMO Project Certified, & Paleo-Friendly!
Unsweetened and meant to be used with your favorite sweetener, or none at all, and great in your sweet and savory recipes too!
Comes as a package of Three, 11.2oz shelf-stable containers. Refrigerate after opening.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
